metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: The MUlti-Scale Observation EXperiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces 2012 (MUSOEXE-12)-dataset of flux observation matrix (No.13 eddy covariance system)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：非均匀下垫面地表蒸散发的多尺度观测试验-通量观测矩阵数据集（13号点涡动相关仪）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the No.13 site eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 27 May to 20 September, 2012. The site (100.37852° E, 38.86074° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in Daman irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1550.73 m. The EC was installed at a height of 5 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.18 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年5月27日至9月20日的通量观测矩阵中13号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.37852E, 38.86074N，海拔1550.73m。涡动相关仪架高5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是18cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。一源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，一源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改进了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比–能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而变得主导。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组分温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组分温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在蒸发通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值相符。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in collecting multiscale observation data in heterogeneous landscapes is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes.

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that includes measurements for evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?

Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is the one obtained from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), which includes data from a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor network, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, specifically designed to cover evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是从黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）获得的数据，该数据集包括来自通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感的数据，专门设计用于覆盖异质土地表面的蒸散发。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific data processing techniques used to convert raw eddy covariance data into usable flux measurements within heterogeneous landscapes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 将原始涡度协方差数据转换为可用通量测量值的具体数据处理技术在异质景观中有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic temperature correction, density correction, quality evaluation of flux values
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 离群值去除，时间延迟校正，坐标旋转，频率响应校正，声温校正，密度校正，通量值的质量评估

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with measuring evapotranspiration in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，测量蒸散发面临的挑战有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: incomplete energy balance closure, errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures, influence of strong advection, uncertainties in component temperatures
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量平衡闭合不完整、确定地表土壤和植被组分温度的误差、强烈平流的影响、组分温度的不确定性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the term 'frequency response correction' imply in the processing of flux observation data?
Definition.QuestionCn: “频率响应校正”在通量观测数据处理中的含义是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Frequency response correction is a data processing step applied to flux observation data to adjust for the loss of high-frequency signals that can occur due to sensor limitations or data processing techniques. It ensures that the measurements reflect the true variability of the fluxes being studied by compensating for any attenuation of the signal over certain frequencies.
Definition.AnswerCn: 频率响应校正是对通量观测数据进行的数据处理步骤，旨在调整由于传感器限制或数据处理技术导致的高频信号损失。它通过补偿在某些频率范围内信号的衰减，确保测量结果反映所研究通量的真实变异性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do the coordination and integration of ground-based and remote sensing data contribute to understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 地面和遥感数据的协调与整合如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of ground-based and remote sensing data enables a detailed examination of eco-hydrological processes by combining high-resolution, localized measurements with broader spatial observations. Ground-based data, such as those from eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations, provide precise and continuous measurements of fluxes and meteorological variables. Remote sensing data, collected through methods like LiDAR and multispectral imaging, offer extensive spatial coverage and the ability to assess landscape-scale interactions. Together, these data sources facilitate a more holistic understanding of the interactions between vegetation, soil, and atmospheric processes in oasis-desert systems, addressing the challenges posed by their inherent heterogeneity.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 地面和遥感数据的结合使得对生态水文过程的详细研究成为可能，通过将高分辨率的局部测量与更广泛的空间观测相结合。地面数据，如涡度协方差系统和自动气象站的数据，提供了精确和连续的通量和气象变量测量。遥感数据通过激光雷达和多光谱成像等方法收集，提供了广泛的空间覆盖能力，并能够评估景观尺度的相互作用。这些数据源的结合促进了对绿植、土壤和大气过程在绿洲-沙漠系统中相互作用的更全面理解，从而应对其固有异质性所带来的挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to difficulties in measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes using traditional models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用传统模型测量蒸散发的困难因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: One-source evapotranspiration estimation models cannot accurately estimate surface evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes because they combine soil and vegetation components into a single source, which does not account for the mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Additionally, traditional models like the Shuttleworth and Wallace model are complex and require parameters and observations that are not readily available from operational satellite- and ground-based data, limiting their application.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 单源蒸散发估算模型无法准确估计异质景观中的表面蒸散发，因为它们将土壤和植被成分合并为一个单一来源，这并未考虑不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合。此外，传统模型如Shuttleworth和Wallace模型复杂，所需的参数和观测数据并不容易从操作卫星和地面数据中获得，限制了它们的应用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a challenge in obtaining accurate multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在获取异质表面生态水文过程的准确多尺度观测时，面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge in obtaining accurate multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. This is compounded by the complexity of designing instrumentation and observation systems that can capture data across hierarchically nested scales to address the grand challenge of upscaling these processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上获取生态水文过程的准确多尺度观测的挑战在于多尺度观测的可用性较差。这一问题因设计能够跨层次嵌套尺度捕获数据的仪器和观测系统的复杂性而加剧，以应对将这些过程进行上尺度处理的重大挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes of uncertainty in estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业地区，估算表面通量的不确定性原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Uncertainty in estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is primarily caused by errors in determining surface–air temperature differences. This is often due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions further complicates accurate estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，估计表面通量的不确定性主要源于表面与空气温度差的测定误差。这通常是由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差。此外，这些地区强烈的对流环境进一步加大了准确估计的难度。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using eddy covariance systems with incomplete energy balance closure on the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用能量平衡闭合不完全的涡度协方差系统对蒸散发估计的准确性有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems with incomplete energy balance closure can lead to challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes, particularly in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. This may result in uncertainties in the estimation of latent and sensible heat fluxes, affecting the reliability of evapotranspiration estimates.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用能量平衡闭合不完全的涡度协方差系统可能会导致在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域中准确估计表面通量的挑战。这可能导致潜热和显热通量估计的不确定性，从而影响蒸散发估计的可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the implementation of quality control measures during data collection and processing impact the reliability of multiscale observational datasets in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，数据收集和处理过程中实施质量控制措施如何影响多尺度观测数据集的可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The implementation of quality control measures throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation ensures the reliability and accuracy of multiscale observational datasets. This rigorous approach is crucial for obtaining trustworthy data that can be used to analyze eco-hydrological processes accurately.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的整个过程中实施质量控制措施，确保了多尺度观测数据集的可靠性和准确性。这种严格的方法对于获得可以准确分析生态水文过程的可信数据至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of implementing multiscale eco-hydrological observations in oasis-desert areas using a hierarchical instrumentation approach?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区实施多尺度生态水文观测的主要目标是采用分层仪器方法。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data through hierarchically nested scales, allowing for a comprehensive understanding of these processes in oasis-desert systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是通过获取分层嵌套尺度的多尺度和多学科数据，解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，从而全面理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的这些过程。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended goals of using eddy covariance systems and remote sensing technologies in the context of the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究中，使用涡度协方差系统和遥感技术的预期目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended goals are to acquire high-quality, multiscale datasets that capture eco-hydrological processes across diverse landscapes, facilitating the study of oasis-desert interactions and providing valuable data for modeling and understanding regional water cycles and ecosystem dynamics.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期目标是获取高质量的多尺度数据集，以捕捉不同景观中的生态水文过程，促进对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的研究，并为区域水循环和生态系统动态的建模与理解提供有价值的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the main steps involved in processing eddy covariance data to ensure quality and accuracy before it is used in flux calculations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
处理涡度协方差数据以确保在进行通量计算之前的质量和准确性，主要涉及以下步骤：

1. 数据采集：确保传感器和设备正常工作，定期校准。
2. 数据预处理：去除不完整或异常的数据点，进行时间同步。
3. 质量控制：应用质量控制标准，识别和剔除低质量数据。
4. 频谱分析：检查数据的频谱特性，确保信号的完整性。
5. 湍流通量计算：使用适当的算法计算通量，考虑气象条件和传感器特性。
6. 归一化和校正：对数据进行归一化处理，校正系统误差。
7. 数据验证：与其他测量方法或模型结果进行比较，验证数据的可靠性。
8. 数据存档：将处理后的数据存档，以便后续分析和使用。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The main steps involved in processing eddy covariance data include despiking, time delay correction, coordinate rotation (double rotation), frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction (WPL correction). Additionally, quality control checks are performed, focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity tests. Data is screened to remove erroneous data from instrument errors, data from the hour before and after precipitation, data with a missing rate greater than 3% within a 30-minute interval, and data from nighttime with weak turbulence (u* less than 0.1 m/s).
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 处理涡度协方差数据的主要步骤包括去尖峰、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转（双旋转）、频率响应校正、声学虚温校正和密度校正（WPL校正）。此外，还进行质量控制检查，重点关注大气稳定性和湍流相似性测试。数据经过筛选，以去除仪器错误导致的错误数据、降水前后一个小时的数据、在30分钟内缺失率超过3%的数据，以及夜间湍流较弱（u*小于0.1 m/s）时的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to accurately partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using ground-based observations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾，采用了哪些方法，使用地面观测数据？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration is achieved using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures. These are obtained via a high-resolution thermal camera and used as inputs to a series two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. The Craig-Gordon model is applied to further partition ET using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques alongside eddy covariance measurements. The component temperatures are calculated by classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels, followed by converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation data and soil and canopy emissivities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 蒸散发的分 partitioning 为蒸发和蒸腾是通过地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度来实现的。这些温度通过高分辨率热像仪获得，并作为一系列双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的输入。Craig-Gordon模型被应用于进一步使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差测量来分 partitioning ET。组件温度是通过将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素来计算的，然后通过使用入射长波辐射数据和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the high-frequency collection of eddy covariance data in agricultural settings?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在农业环境中能够高频率收集涡度协方差数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz, as mentioned in the metadata, enables high-frequency data collection. These systems are placed at specific heights and orientations to capture detailed flux measurements, which are crucial for assessing evapotranspiration in heterogeneous agricultural landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度协方差系统，如元数据中所提到的，可以实现高频数据收集。这些系统被放置在特定的高度和方向，以捕捉详细的通量测量，这对于评估异质农业景观中的蒸散发至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there a concern regarding the overestimation of component temperatures in the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, and how does it affect data collection outcomes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 关于两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中组件温度的过高估计存在担忧，这会影响数据收集的结果。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The concern arises because of errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature, which can lead to inaccurate estimates of ET. This is particularly crucial in strongly advective environments where accurate separation of soil and vegetation temperatures is needed for reliable model performance and validation against ground measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的错误，导致蒸散发（ET）估计不准确，这引发了关注。在强烈的平流环境中，准确分离土壤和植被温度对于模型的可靠性能和与地面测量的验证尤为重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection techniques in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集技术在捕捉异质景观中的多尺度生态水文过程方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection techniques, as part of the HiWATER experiment, involve a combination of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing tools like LiDAR and thermal imagers. These instruments are arranged in hierarchically nested scales, which enhances their effectiveness in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. However, challenges such as image classification errors affecting soil and canopy temperature estimates and the limited availability of multiscale observations still present hurdles.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的HiWATER实验数据收集技术包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及激光雷达和热成像仪等遥感工具。这些仪器以层次嵌套的方式排列，从而增强了它们在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程中的有效性。然而，图像分类错误影响土壤和冠层温度估计，以及多尺度观测的有限可用性，仍然是面临的挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges researchers face when using current methodologies to separate soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective irrigated areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 研究人员在强对流灌溉区域使用当前方法分离土壤和冠层成分温度时面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: In strongly advective irrigated areas, researchers face challenges such as errors in derived component temperatures due to image classification errors, which can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Uncertainties in estimating atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as errors in incoming radiation transmittance through the canopy, further complicate the separation of soil and canopy component temperatures.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉区域，研究人员面临挑战，例如由于图像分类错误导致的衍生组件温度错误，这可能导致对冠层温度的高估。估计大气上行辐射和透射率的不确定性，以及通过冠层的入射辐射透射率的错误，进一步复杂化了土壤和冠层组件温度的分离。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can existing datasets from experiments like HiWATER be expanded or refined to improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimations in heterogeneous terrains?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何扩展或精炼像HiWATER这样的实验现有数据集，以提高在异质地形中蒸散发估算的准确性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Existing datasets from experiments like HiWATER can be expanded or refined by improving the precision of ground-based measurements, enhancing sensor calibration processes, and incorporating additional high-resolution remote sensing data. Addressing classification errors and improving the separation techniques for soil and canopy temperatures would also contribute to more accurate evapotranspiration estimations. Furthermore, integrating advanced isotopic techniques and expanding the spatial and temporal resolution of observations could enhance dataset accuracy and applicability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 现有的实验数据集，如HiWATER，可以通过提高地面测量的精度、增强传感器校准过程以及整合更多高分辨率的遥感数据来扩展或精细化。解决分类错误和改善土壤与冠层温度的分离技术也将有助于更准确的蒸散发估算。此外，整合先进的同位素技术并扩大观测的空间和时间分辨率可以提高数据集的准确性和适用性。
